info.name: Ericsson NCM API
info.description:
# Ericsson Enterprise Wireless NetCloud Manager API

---

## Overview

This Postman collection is designed to make it easy to interact with the **Ericsson Enterprise Wireless NetCloud Manager API**.

It includes:

- Preconfigured requests for API endpoints
    
- Support for **bulk operations** using CSV input
    
- **Automation workflows** that call multiple endpoints in sequence
    

---

## Setup API Keys

### Step 1: Create NCM APIv2 Keys

Before using this collection, you must create **NetCloud Manager APIv2 keys**.

Follow the official Ericsson documentation:  
[https://docs.cradlepoint.com/r/NCM-APIv2-Overview/Obtaining-API-Keys](https://docs.cradlepoint.com/r/NCM-APIv2-Overview/Obtaining-API-Keys)

You will generate the API credentials required for authentication in Postman.

---

### Step 2: Create and Select an Environment

1. Open **Postman**.
    
2. Click the **Environment dropdown** in the top-right (it may say _No Environment_).
    
3. Click **Add Environment**.
    
4. Name the environment (for example: `NetCloud Manager`).
    

---

### Step 3: Add the Required Variables

Add the following variables to the environment and enter the **actual values** for your account.

| Variable Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `X-ECM-API-ID` | Your ECM API ID |
| `X-ECM-API-KEY` | Your ECM API Key |
| `X-CP-API-ID` | Your CP API ID |
| `X-CP-API-KEY` | Your CP API Key |

**Important:**

Do **not** include `{{ }}` when entering the values.

The braces are only used when referencing variables in requests.

Click **Save**, then select this environment from the dropdown.

---

## Making a Request

1. Expand a folder in the collection.
    
2. Click on a request.
    
3. Review the request (no changes required).
    
4. Click **Send**.
    
5. View the **Response** panel at the bottom.
    

---

## ï»¿Test Your Setup

1. Open the **`accounts/`** folder.
    
2. Click **Get Accounts Information**.
    
3. Click **Send**.
    

âœ… If everything is configured correctly, you should receive:

- **Status:** `200 OK`
    
- **Response Body:** Account information in JSON format
    

If you receive a `401` or `403` error, verify:

- The correct environment is selected
    
- API key values are entered correctly and saved
    

---

## Bulk Operations with CSV Input

This collection supports **bulk operations** using CSV files.

- CSV column headers must match the variable names used in requests.
    
- Each row in the CSV represents one execution of the selected request.
    

### Commonly Used Variables

- `{{id}}` â†’ Router ID
    
- `{{mac}}` â†’ Router MAC address
    
- `{{serial_number}}` â†’ Router serial number
    
- `{{ip_address}}` â†’ IP address
    

### Example CSV

```
id,mac,serial_number,ip_address
12345,AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF,SN001,192.168.1.10
67890,11:22:33:44:55:66,SN002,192.168.1.11

 ```

Postman will automatically substitute each column value into the matching variable.

---

### Running a Bulk Operation in Postman

1. In the collection, click the **folder** that contains the endpoint you want to run in bulk.
    
2. In the **top-right corner of the folder**, click the **Run** button.
    
3. In the Collection Runner:
    
    - Select the **specific request** you want to execute.
        
4. Under **Test data file**, click **Select File**.
    
5. Choose **Select from computer**.
    
6. Select your CSV file.
    
7. Click **Use Locally**.
    
8. Click **Run Ericsson NCM API**.
    

Postman will execute the request once for **each row in the CSV**, substituting values from the CSV into the request variables.

---

### Automation Workflows

The **Automation Workflows** folder contains prebuilt workflows that:

- Call **multiple API endpoints**
    
- Perform common multi-step operations automatically
    

ðŸ“Œ Click into each folder inside **Automation Workflows** to see:

- What the workflow does
    
- Which endpoints it calls
    
- How data flows between requests

item.name: > Automation Workflows <
Bulk Router Configuration Change

exec: // Determine which identifier is present in the CSV row (prefer id > mac > serial_number)

pm.test("CSV row has a valid identifier (id, mac, or serial_number)", function () {
pm.expect(identifier, "No identifier (id, mac, or serial_number) found in CSV row").to.not.be.null;
pm.expect(identifier, "No identifier (id, mac, or serial_number) found in CSV row").to.not.be.undefined;

pm.expect(actualUrl, "URL does not match expected pattern: " + expectedUrlPattern).to.equal(expectedUrlPattern);
// Test: Response should contain data array
// Extract config_manager_id from response and set for next request
// SUCCESS PATH: ID found - store it and continue to next request
pm.test("Configuration manager ID extracted successfully", function () {
// Do NOT call setNextRequest(null) here - let the run continue to PATCH
// FAILURE PATH: No ID found - stop execution
pm.test("Configuration manager found for router", function () {
pm.expect.fail("No configuration manager found for router with " + identifierKey + ": " + identifier);
// Stop the collection/folder run - do not proceed to PATCH request
// Pre-request script: Determine which identifier is present and store for post-response script
// Store identifier info for post-response script to use

request.description: Fetches the configuration manager record for a router using the router ID from CSV iteration data. Extracts config_manager_id for the next PATCH request.

exec: pm.test("Response JSON is not empty", function () {
// Optional: verify configuration is present in response, if API echoes it
pm.test("Response has configuration array (if present)", function () {
// Pre-request script: Wrap raw JSON body in { "configuration": ... } if needed
throw new Error("Invalid JSON in request body: " + parseError.message);
// Check if the parsed body is an array or object (but not already wrapped in "configuration")
// If it's already an object with only a "configuration" key, leave it alone
console.log("Body already has 'configuration' wrapper, no changes made.");
// Overwrite the request body with the wrapped JSON
// Throw a clear error that will show in Postman
throw new Error("Pre-request script error: " + error.message);

request.description: Updates the configuration manager record. Customize the JSON body with the fields you need to update.

item.description:
# Bulk Router Configuration Change

This automation workflow enables bulk dynamic configuration updates to routers  
in NCM using CSV input files.

## HOW IT WORKS

1. The workflow automatically detects router identifiers from your CSV file
    
2. For each router, it retrieves the configuration_manager ID via GET request
    
3. It then sends a PATCH request to update the router configuration
    

## ROUTER IDENTIFIERS SUPPORTED

The workflow automatically detects and uses any of the following identifiers  
from your CSV file:  
â€¢ id  
â€¢ mac  
â€¢ serial_number

## SETUP INSTRUCTIONS

1. Create a configuration JSON template:
    
    - Make your desired changes in the NCM configuration editor
        
    - Click the "View Pending Changes" button
        
    - Copy the generated JSON
        
2. Configure the Postman request:
    
    - Open the "Update Configuration Manager" request in this folder
        
    - Navigate to the Body tab
        
    - Paste your JSON template into the request body
        
    - Replace any values in the JSON with variable names that match your CSV column  
        names, using double curly braces (e.g., {{column_name}})  
        Example: If your CSV has an "asset_id" column, replace the IP address  
        value in the JSON with {{asset_id}}:
        
        \[  
        {  
        "system": {  
        "asset_id": {{asset_id}}  
        }  
        },  
        \[\]  
        \]
        
3. Prepare your CSV file:
    
    - Ensure your CSV contains at least one of the supported router identifiers  
        (id, mac, or serial_number)
        
    - Include any additional data needed for your configuration updates
        
4. Run Workflow:
    
    - Click the "Run" button in the top right of this folder
        
    - Click "Select File" under "Test data file"
        
    - Click "Select from computer" and select your CSV file
        
    - Click "Use locally"
        
    - Click the "Run Ericsson NCM API" button
        
    - The workflow will process each row in your CSV file
        
    - Each router will be updated with the configuration template you provided

The **Automation Workflows** folder contains prebuilt workflows that:

- Call **multiple API endpoints**
    
- Perform common multi-step operations automatically
    

ðŸ“Œ Click into each folder inside **Automation Workflows** to see:

- What the workflow does
    
- Which endpoints it calls
    
- How data flows between requests

item.name: Account Authorizations (BETA)

query.description: Cursor for next page.
Cursor for prior page.
Number of results to return per page.

The search query param performs a case insensitive substring search on a set of fields.
A record matches if any search field matches the search text.
If the search param doesn't include a field list, the server selects the fields.
Example:
  • Search by substring: `search=substring1,substring2`
  • Search by field(s) and substring: `search[fieldA,fieldB]=substring1,substring2,substring3`
Which field to use when ordering the results.

request.description: Return a list of account authorizations

Update an existing account authorization

item.description:
Use the account_authorizations endpoint to view and modify the NetCloud Manager roles for the users in your account. User roles specify the level of access to features and functionality for NetCloud Manager users.

Try out this endpoint:
  1. Click the Authorize button and then add your API v3 bearer token.
  2. Click a method to view information about the method's parameters and responses.
  3. Click the Try it out button.
  4. Add values for parameters (optional). Note that some parameters may be marked as required and must have a value.
  5. Click Execute to call the method for the endpoint. The response is shown below the Execute button.

request.description:
This method gives a list of accounts with its information. The API also provides 'filter' parameter. Results can be filtered by field values. Example:
format=JSON&mac=003044123456
Fields from sub-resources can be specified. Example:
format=JSON&product.name=MBR1400
Multiple values can be matched:
mac__in=003044123456,003044789012
-->Example URL
 https://www.cradlepointecm.com/api/v2/accounts/?id=1127&name=cradlepoint

item.description:
Use the asset_endpoints endpoint to obtain a list of all routers and adapters in an account.

Try out these endpoints:
  1. Click the Authorize button and then add your API v3 bearer token.
  2. Click a method to view information about the method's parameters and responses.
  3. Click the Try it out button.
  4. Add values for parameters (optional). Note that some parameters may be marked as required and must have a value.
  5. Click Execute to call the method for the endpoint. The response is shown below the Execute button.

Use the following links to get support for using the NetCloud Manager API:

item.description:
The esim_profiles endpoint allows you to get information about the eSIM profiles in your account. This information includes the eid, iccid, id and profile name etc for each of the eSIM profiles in your account.

The esim_profile_activations endpoint is used to perform validation and execution related to activating carrier profiles on eSims in your Cradlepoint devices.

  5. Click Execute to call the method for the endpoint. The response is shown below the Execute button.

query.description: (Required) The ID of the router that sent the location data. This parameter is REQUIRED. Only one router ID may be specified per query; you can't provide a list of router IDs to this endpoint.

query.description: Cursor for next page.
Cursor for prior page.
Number of results to return per page.

The search query param performs a case insensitive substring search on a set of fields.
A record matches if any search field matches the search text.
If the search param doesn't include a field list, the server selects the fields.
Example:
  • Search by substring: `search=substring1,substring2`
  • Search by field(s) and substring: `search[fieldA,fieldB]=substring1,substring2,substring3`

item.name: Regrades
item.description:
Use the regrades endpoint to upgrade, downgrade, license or unlicense devices in bulk operations. The regrades endpoint allows you to specify multiple devices (using MAC addresses) and perform licensing operations on them with one API call.

Try out this endpoint:
  1. Click the Authorize button and then add your API v3 bearer token.
  2. Click a method to view information about the method's parameters and responses.
  3. Click the Try it out button.
  4. Add values for parameters (optional). Note that some parameters may be marked as required and must have a value.
  5. Click Execute to call the method for the endpoint. The response is shown below the Execute button.

Use the following links to get support for using the NetCloud Manager API:

request.description:
Use the PUT method on this endpoint to update a routers record. Include the fields/values to update for the record in the body as a JSON object.

```
{
    "account": "",
    "asset_id": "",
    "custom1": "",
    "custom2": "",
    "description": "",
    "group": "",
    "name": "",
}

 ```

body.raw:
{
    "account": "https://www.cradlepointecm.comapi/v2/accounts/{account_id}/",
    "asset_id": "12345",
    "custom1": "My Custom1",
    "custom2": "My Custom2",
    "description": "My Router Description",
    "group": "https://www.cradlepointecm.comapi/v2/groups/{group_id}/",
    "name": "My Router Name"
}

request.description:
Gets the results of a speed test job. The results are updated with the latest known state of the speed tests. Example URL
 https://www.cradlepointecm.com/api/v2/speed_test/{id}/
Deletes a speed test job.

Used to create and queue a speed test job. Once started the speed test job will queue as many individual speed tests as the system allows. When a speed test finishes more speed tests are started. This repeats until all the speed tests have completed.

```
{
  "account": "https://www.cradlepointecm.com/api/v2/accounts/1/",
  "config": {
    "host": "YOURTESTSERVER.COM",
    "max_test_concurrency": 5,
    "net_device_ids": [
      12345678
    ],
    "port": 12865,
    "size": null,
    "test_timeout": 10,
    "test_type": "TCP Download",
    "time": 10
  }
}

 ```

item.description:
Subscriptions define the features available to you in NetCloud Manager. The subscriptions endpoint returns information about the subscriptions in your account.

Try out this endpoint:
  1. Click the Authorize button and then add your API v3 bearer token.
  2. Click a method to view information about the method's parameters and responses.
  3. Click the Try it out button.
  4. Add values for parameters (optional). Note that some parameters may be marked as required and must have a value.
  5. Click Execute to call the method for the endpoint. The response is shown below the Execute button.

Use the following links to get support for using the NetCloud Manager API:

query.description: Cursor for next page.
Cursor for prior page.
Number of results to return per page.

The search query param performs a case insensitive substring search on a set of fields.
A record matches if any search field matches the search text.
If the search param doesn't include a field list, the server selects the fields.
Example:
  • Search by substring: `search=substring1,substring2`
  • Search by field(s) and substring: `search[fieldA,fieldB]=substring1,substring2,substring3`

item.description:
The tenant_authorizations endpoint lists the authorizations for all of the users and collaborators in the account tenant and whether they have a 'user' or 'admin' permission. The 'admin' role is the 'Add/Edit User (User Administrator)' permission displayed in the NetCloud web interface. All other users have the 'user' permission.

Try out this endpoint:
  1. Click the Authorize button and then add your API v3 bearer token.
  2. Click a method to view information about the method's parameters and responses.

item.name: Unmasked Wifi Passwords (BETA)

query.description: List of IDâ€™s to extract the Wi-Fi passwords from.

request.description: Returns a list of unmasked Wi-Fi passwords

item.description:
Use the unmasked_wifi_passwords endpoint to unmask and view Wi-Fi passwords for devices. Passwords for multiple devices can be unmasked by using the IDs of the devices as query params. For example, '?router=<id1>, <id2>'. Up to 100 device IDs can be passed in each call to this endpoint.

Note that NCM Administrator privileges are required to call the unmasked_wifi_passwords endpoint.
